text:
Draught at Ølfestival 2017.
Hazy amber coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, citrus and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops, citrus and pine needles.
Hoppy finish.
Light sweet & light sour aroma like a stack of old dried grass. Hazy dark golden with a white head. Light sweet & light bitter. Full bodied, creamy texture & soft carbonation.
Cloudy golden with a small white head. Bready and grainy aroma with cardboard. Sweet grainy flavour
Fairly watery and slightly metallic, somewhat hoppy though. Not overall very pleased.

Bottle. 2.7%. Best before 18.02.17. Pours a slightly hazy amber/golden, with an off-white/yellowish head. Good lacing. Crispy (citrus) hop aroma, on a background of fruit, malt and light cereals. Feels a bit dusty and/or earthy. Flavour is sweetish, fruity and hoppy; the hops are a bit funky/cheesy. Light metallic overtone. Bitter hop finish. Hint of liquorice. Lingering light grassy note. Overall okay, although (despite?) the low alcohol content is noticable. Decent hop profile. 24.10.16.

Sample @ [ DOE - Olfestival Kobenhavn 2016 (Beerfestival Copenhagen) ] @ Lokomotivvaerkstedet, Otto Busses Vej 5A, 2450 Copenhagen SV, Denmark. [ As Syndikatet Politikeren Idealistisk Frokostøl ].Unclear matt - grey medium orange yellow color with a small, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, bread, fruity malt, moderate hoppy, citrus, orange, grass, vegetable notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average duration, fruity malt, pale malt, citrus, grass, hoppy, bread - vegetable notes. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20160519]
DØE. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, bready and light hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. A bit watery. 190516
Bottle at KØ16. Rough catty hop aroma. Clear golden colour. Good stable white head. The flavour has some mango and cat, and a quite rough bitterness, actually a little unpleasant.
50 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is grainy andslight toasted malty. Bitter, dry and slight herbal. Toasted and straw to herbal finish.
Bottled. A golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of hops, straw, and fruit punch. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, malt, and fruits, leading to a bitter finish.
Bottled. Golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, caramel, fruit, straw and bitterness.

Malty, fruity and wort of the fragrance. The taste is fruity, bitter and slightly malty. Okay bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth forever. This beer impressed a little on me. Much taste for as low alcohol percentage. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours amber with a slight haze and a small, off-white head. Surprisingly intense hop aroma. Light body, but not watery, subtle caramel but dominated by intense if somewhat dusty hops. Very fruity, very bitter finish. Surprisingly potent considering its strength. 080216
